results.title: Genesis 25:26
results.preview: And after that came his brother out; and his hand took hold of Esau’s heel; and his name was called Jacob. And Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.

results.title: Genesis 25:27
results.preview: And the boys grew, and Esau became a man skilled in hunting, a man of the field; and Jacob was a homely man, dwelling in tents.

results.title: Genesis 25:28
results.preview: And Isaac loved Esau, because venison was to his taste; and Rebecca loved Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 25:29
results.preview: And Jacob had cooked a dish; and Esau came from the field, and he was faint.

results.title: Genesis 25:30
results.preview: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with the red—the red thing there, for I am faint. Therefore was his name called Edom.

results.title: Genesis 25:31
results.preview: And Jacob said, Sell me now thy birthright.

results.title: Genesis 25:33
results.preview: And Jacob said, Swear unto me now. And he swore unto him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 25:34
results.preview: And Jacob gave Esau bread and the dish of lentils; and he ate and drank, and rose up and went away. Thus Esau despised the birthright.

results.title: Genesis 27:6
results.preview: And Rebecca spoke to Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak to Esau thy brother, saying,

results.title: Genesis 27:11
results.preview: And Jacob said to Rebecca his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.

results.title: Genesis 27:15
results.preview: And Rebecca took the clothes of her elder son Esau, the costly ones which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son;

results.title: Genesis 27:17
results.preview: and she gave the savoury dishes and the bread that she had prepared into the hand of her son Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 27:19
results.preview: And Jacob said to his father, I am Esau, thy firstborn. I have done according as thou didst say to me. Arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, in order that thy soul may bless me.

results.title: Genesis 27:21
results.preview: And Isaac said to Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be really my son Esau or not.

results.title: Genesis 27:22
results.preview: And Jacob drew near to Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

results.title: Genesis 27:30
results.preview: And it came to pass when Isaac had ended blessing Jacob, and when Jacob was only just gone out from Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came from his hunting.

results.title: Genesis 27:36
results.preview: And he said, Is it not therefore he was named Jacob, for he has supplanted me now twice? He took away my birthright, and behold, now he has taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?

results.title: Genesis 27:41
results.preview: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father had blessed him. And Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand, and I will slay my brother Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 27:42
results.preview: And the words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebecca. And she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, comforts himself that he will kill thee.

results.title: Genesis 27:46
results.preview: And Rebecca said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good should my life do me?

results.title: Genesis 28:1
results.preview: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said to him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

results.title: Genesis 28:5
results.preview: And Isaac sent away Jacob; and he went to Padan-Aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebecca, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.

results.title: Genesis 28:6
results.preview: And Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padan-Aram, to take a wife thence, blessing him, and giving him a charge saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

results.title: Genesis 28:7
results.preview: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padan-Aram.

results.title: Genesis 28:10
results.preview: And Jacob went out from Beer-sheba, and went towards Haran.

results.title: Genesis 28:16
results.preview: And Jacob awoke from his sleep, and said, Surely Jehovah is in this place, and I knew it not.

results.title: Genesis 28:18
results.preview: And Jacob rose early in the morning, and took the stone that he had made his pillow, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil on the top of it.

results.title: Genesis 28:20
results.preview: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and keep me on this road that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and a garment to put on,

results.title: Genesis 29:1
results.preview: And Jacob continued his journey, and went into the land of the children of the east.

results.title: Genesis 29:4
results.preview: And Jacob said to them, My brethren, whence are ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.

results.title: Genesis 29:10
results.preview: And it came to pass when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the mouth of the well, and watered the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother.

results.title: Genesis 29:11
results.preview: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice and wept.

results.title: Genesis 29:12
results.preview: And Jacob told Rachel that he was a brother of her father, and that he was Rebecca’s son; and she ran and told her father.

results.title: Genesis 29:13
results.preview: And it came to pass when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house; and he told Laban all these things.

results.title: Genesis 29:15
results.preview: And Laban said to Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou serve me for nothing? tell me, what shall be thy wages?

results.title: Genesis 29:18
results.preview: And Jacob loved Rachel, and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.

results.title: Genesis 29:20
results.preview: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they were in his eyes as single days, because he loved her.

results.title: Genesis 29:21
results.preview: And Jacob said to Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her.

results.title: Genesis 29:28
results.preview: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled the week with this one, and he gave him Rachel his daughter to be his wife.

results.title: Genesis 30:1
results.preview: And when Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister, and said to Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.

results.title: Genesis 30:2
results.preview: And Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, Am I in God’s stead, who has withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?

results.title: Genesis 30:4
results.preview: And she gave him Bilhah her maidservant as wife, and Jacob went in to her.

results.title: Genesis 30:5
results.preview: And Bilhah conceived, and bore Jacob a son.

results.title: Genesis 30:7
results.preview: And Bilhah Rachel’s maidservant again conceived, and bore Jacob a second son.

results.title: Genesis 30:9
results.preview: And when Leah saw that she had ceased to bear, she took Zilpah her maidservant and gave her to Jacob as wife.

results.title: Genesis 30:10
results.preview: And Zilpah Leah’s maidservant bore Jacob a son.

results.title: Genesis 30:12
results.preview: And Zilpah Leah’s maidservant bore Jacob a second son.

results.title: Genesis 30:16
results.preview: And when Jacob came from the fields in the evening, Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in to me, for indeed I have hired thee with my son’s mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.

results.title: Genesis 30:17
results.preview: And God hearkened to Leah, and she conceived, and bore Jacob a fifth son.

results.title: Genesis 30:19
results.preview: And Leah again conceived, and bore Jacob a sixth son;

results.title: Genesis 30:25
results.preview: And it came to pass when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, Send me away, that I may go to my place and to my country.

results.title: Genesis 30:31
results.preview: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me anything. If thou doest this for me, I will again feed and keep thy flock:

results.title: Genesis 30:36
results.preview: And he put three days’ journey between himself and Jacob. And Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flock.

results.title: Genesis 30:37
results.preview: And Jacob took fresh rods of white poplar, almond-tree, and maple; and peeled off white stripes in them, uncovering the white which was on the rods.

results.title: Genesis 30:40
results.preview: And Jacob separated the lambs, and set the faces of the flock toward the ringstraked, and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he made himself separate flocks, and did not put them with Laban’s flock.

results.title: Genesis 30:41
results.preview: And it came to pass whensoever the strong cattle were ardent, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might become ardent among the rods;

results.title: Genesis 30:42
results.preview: but when the sheep were feeble, he put them not in; so the feeble were Laban’s, and the strong Jacob’s.

results.title: Genesis 31:1
results.preview: And he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob has taken away all that was our father’s, and of what was our father’s he has acquired all this glory.

results.title: Genesis 31:2
results.preview: And Jacob saw the countenance of Laban, and behold, it was not toward him as previously.

results.title: Genesis 31:3
results.preview: And Jehovah said to Jacob, Return into the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.

results.title: Genesis 31:4
results.preview: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the fields to his flock,

results.title: Genesis 31:11
results.preview: And the Angel of God said to me in a dream, Jacob! And I said, Here am I.

results.title: Genesis 31:17
results.preview: And Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels,

results.title: Genesis 31:20
results.preview: And Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian, in that he did not tell him that he fled.

results.title: Genesis 31:22
results.preview: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled.

results.title: Genesis 31:24
results.preview: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said to him, Take care thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.

results.title: Genesis 31:25
results.preview: And Laban came up with Jacob; and Jacob had pitched his tent on the mountain; Laban also with his brethren pitched on mount Gilead.

results.title: Genesis 31:26
results.preview: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast deceived me, and hast carried away my daughters as captives of war?

results.title: Genesis 31:29
results.preview: It would be in the power of my hand to do you hurt; but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, Take care that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.

results.title: Genesis 31:31
results.preview: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, I was afraid; for I said, Lest thou shouldest take by force thy daughters from me.

results.title: Genesis 31:32
results.preview: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, he shall not live. Before our brethren discern what is thine with me, and take it to thee. But Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.

results.title: Genesis 31:33
results.preview: And Laban went into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the two handmaids’ tents, and found nothing; and he went out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.

results.title: Genesis 31:36
results.preview: And Jacob was angry, and he disputed with Laban. And Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my fault, what my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?

results.title: Genesis 31:43
results.preview: And Laban answered and said to Jacob, The daughters are my daughters, and the sons are my sons, and the flock is my flock, and all that thou seest is mine; but as for my daughters, what can I do this day to them, or to their sons whom they have brought forth?

results.title: Genesis 31:45
results.preview: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

results.title: Genesis 31:46
results.preview: And Jacob said to his brethren, Gather stones. And they took stones, and made a heap, and ate there upon the heap.

results.title: Genesis 31:47
results.preview: And Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha, and Jacob called it Galeed.

results.title: Genesis 31:51
results.preview: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold the pillar which I have set up between me and thee:

results.title: Genesis 31:53
results.preview: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us! And Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.

results.title: Genesis 31:54
results.preview: And Jacob offered a sacrifice upon the mountain, and invited his brethren to eat bread: and they ate bread, and lodged on the mountain.

results.title: Genesis 32:1
results.preview: And Jacob went on his way; and the angels of God met him.

results.title: Genesis 32:2
results.preview: And when Jacob saw them he said, This is the camp of God. And he called the name of that place Mahanaim.

results.title: Genesis 32:3
results.preview: And Jacob sent messengers before his face to Esau his brother, into the land of Seir, the fields of Edom.

results.title: Genesis 32:4
results.preview: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak to my lord, to Esau: Thy servant Jacob speaks thus—With Laban have I sojourned and tarried until now;

results.title: Genesis 32:6
results.preview: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother, to Esau; and he also is coming to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.

results.title: Genesis 32:7
results.preview: Then Jacob was greatly afraid, and was distressed; and he divided the people that were with him, and the sheep and the cattle and the camels, into two troops.

results.title: Genesis 32:9
results.preview: And Jacob said, God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, Jehovah, who saidst unto me: Return into thy country and to thy kindred, and I will do thee good,

results.title: Genesis 32:18
results.preview: —then thou shalt say, Thy servant Jacob’s: it is a gift sent to my lord, to Esau. And behold, he also is behind us.

results.title: Genesis 32:20
results.preview: And, moreover, ye shall say, Behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will propitiate him with the gift that goes before me, and afterwards I will see his face: perhaps he will accept me.

results.title: Genesis 32:24
results.preview: And Jacob remained alone; and a man wrestled with him until the rising of the dawn.

results.title: Genesis 32:25
results.preview: And when he saw that he did not prevail against him, he touched the joint of his thigh; and the joint of Jacob’s thigh was dislocated as he wrestled with him.

results.title: Genesis 32:27
results.preview: And he said to him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 32:28
results.preview: And he said, Thy name shall not henceforth be called Jacob, but Israel; for thou hast wrestled with God, and with men, and hast prevailed.

results.title: Genesis 32:29
results.preview: And Jacob asked and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, How is it that thou askest after my name? And he blessed him there.

results.title: Genesis 32:30
results.preview: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel—For I have seen God face to face, and my life has been preserved.

results.title: Genesis 32:32
results.preview: Therefore the children of Israel do not eat of the sinew that is over the joint of the thigh, to this day; because he touched the joint of Jacob’s thigh—the sinew.

results.title: Genesis 33:1
results.preview: And Jacob lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. And he distributed the children to Leah, and to Rachel, and to the two maidservants:

results.title: Genesis 33:10
results.preview: And Jacob said, No, I pray thee; if now I have found favour in thine eyes, then receive my gift from my hand; for therefore have I seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, and thou hast received me with pleasure.

results.title: Genesis 33:17
results.preview: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built himself a house, and for his cattle he made booths. Therefore the name of the place was called Succoth.

results.title: Genesis 33:18
results.preview: And Jacob came safely to the city Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padan-Aram; and he encamped before the city.

results.title: Genesis 34:1
results.preview: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

results.title: Genesis 34:3
results.preview: And his soul fastened on Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the maiden, and spoke consolingly to the maiden.

results.title: Genesis 34:5
results.preview: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter; but his sons were with his cattle in the fields, and Jacob said nothing until they came.

results.title: Genesis 34:6
results.preview: And Hamor the father of Shechem came out to Jacob, to speak to him.

results.title: Genesis 34:7
results.preview: And the sons of Jacob came from the fields when they heard it; and the men were grieved, and they were very angry, because he had wrought what was disgraceful in Israel, in lying with Jacob’s daughter, which thing ought not to be done.

results.title: Genesis 34:13
results.preview: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and spoke—because he had defiled Dinah their sister—

results.title: Genesis 34:19
results.preview: And the youth did not delay to do this, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter. And he was honourable above all in the house of his father.

results.title: Genesis 34:25
results.preview: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brethren, took each his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.

results.title: Genesis 34:27
results.preview: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.

results.title: Genesis 34:30
results.preview: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me, in that ye make me odious among the inhabitants of the land—among the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and I am few men in number, and they will gather themselves against me and smite me, and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.

results.title: Genesis 35:1
results.preview: And God said to Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there, and make there an altar unto the •God that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.

results.title: Genesis 35:2
results.preview: And Jacob said to his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and cleanse yourselves, and change your garments;

results.title: Genesis 35:4
results.preview: And they gave to Jacob all the strange gods that were in their hand, and the rings that were in their ears, and Jacob hid them under the terebinth that is by Shechem.

results.title: Genesis 35:5
results.preview: And they journeyed; and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 35:6
results.preview: And Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.

results.title: Genesis 35:9
results.preview: And God appeared to Jacob again after he had come from Padan-Aram, and blessed him.

results.title: Genesis 35:10
results.preview: And God said to him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not henceforth be called Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name. And he called his name Israel.

results.title: Genesis 35:14
results.preview: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he had talked with him, a pillar of stone, and poured on it a drink-offering, and poured oil on it.

results.title: Genesis 35:15
results.preview: And Jacob called the name of the place where God had talked with him, Beth-el.

results.title: Genesis 35:20
results.preview: And Jacob erected a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of Rachel’s grave to this day.

results.title: Genesis 35:22
results.preview: And it came to pass when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine; and Israel heard of it. And the sons of Jacob were twelve.

results.title: Genesis 35:23
results.preview: The sons of Leah: Reuben—Jacob’s firstborn—and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun.

results.title: Genesis 35:26
results.preview: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maidservant: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob that were born to him in Padan-Aram.

results.title: Genesis 35:27
results.preview: And Jacob came to Isaac his father to Mamre—to Kirjath-Arba, which is Hebron; where Abraham had sojourned, and Isaac.

results.title: Genesis 35:29
results.preview: And Isaac expired and died, and was gathered to his peoples, old and full of days. And his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.

results.title: Genesis 36:6
results.preview: And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the souls of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his possessions, that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went into a country away from his brother Jacob.

results.title: Genesis 37:1
results.preview: And Jacob dwelt in the land where his father sojourned—in the land of Canaan.

results.title: Genesis 37:2
results.preview: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, fed the flock with his brethren; and he was doing service with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives. And Joseph brought to his father an evil report of them.

results.title: Genesis 37:34
results.preview: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth on his loins, and mourned for his son many days.

results.title: Genesis 42:1
results.preview: And Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt, and Jacob said to his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?

results.title: Genesis 42:4
results.preview: But Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest mischief may befall him.

results.title: Genesis 42:29
results.preview: And they came into the land of Canaan, to Jacob their father, and told him all that had befallen them, saying,

results.title: Genesis 42:36
results.preview: And Jacob their father said to them, Ye have bereaved me of children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin! All these things are against me.

results.title: Genesis 45:25
results.preview: And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan to Jacob their father.

results.title: Genesis 45:27
results.preview: And they spoke to him all the words of Joseph, which he had spoken to them. And he saw the waggons that Joseph had sent to carry him. And the spirit of Jacob their father revived.

results.title: Genesis 46:2
results.preview: And God spoke to Israel in the visions of the night and said, Jacob, Jacob! And he said, Here am I.

results.title: Genesis 46:5
results.preview: And Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba; and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, on the waggons that Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

results.title: Genesis 46:6
results.preview: And they took their cattle, and their goods which they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and came to Egypt, Jacob and all his seed with him;

results.title: Genesis 46:8
results.preview: And these are the names of the sons of Israel who came into Egypt: Jacob and his sons. Jacob’s firstborn, Reuben.

results.title: Genesis 46:15
results.preview: —These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Padan-Aram; and his daughter, Dinah. All the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty-three.

results.title: Genesis 46:18
results.preview: —These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter; and she bore these to Jacob: sixteen souls.

results.title: Genesis 46:19
results.preview: The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife: Joseph and Benjamin.

results.title: Genesis 46:22
results.preview: —These are the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.

results.title: Genesis 46:25
results.preview: —These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter; and she bore these to Jacob: all the souls were seven.

results.title: Genesis 46:26
results.preview: All the souls that came with Jacob to Egypt, that had come out of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives: all the souls were sixty-six.

results.title: Genesis 46:27
results.preview: And the sons of Joseph who were born to him in Egypt, were two souls. All the souls of the house of Jacob that came to Egypt were seventy.

results.title: Genesis 47:7
results.preview: And Joseph brought Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh. And Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

results.title: Genesis 47:8
results.preview: And Pharaoh said to Jacob, How many are the days of the years of thy life?

results.title: Genesis 47:9
results.preview: And Jacob said to Pharaoh, The days of the years of my sojourning are a hundred and thirty years. Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, and they do not attain to the days of the years of the life of my fathers, in the days of their sojourning.

results.title: Genesis 47:10
results.preview: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from Pharaoh.

results.title: Genesis 47:28
results.preview: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years; and the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were a hundred and forty-seven years.

results.title: Genesis 48:2
results.preview: And one told Jacob and said, Behold, thy son Joseph is coming to thee. And Israel strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed.

results.title: Genesis 48:3
results.preview: And Jacob said to Joseph, The Almighty •God appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,

results.title: Genesis 49:1
results.preview: And Jacob called his sons, and said, Gather yourselves together, and I will tell you what will befall you at the end of days.

results.title: Genesis 49:2
results.preview: Assemble yourselves, and hear, ye sons of Jacob, And listen to Israel your father.

results.title: Genesis 49:7
results.preview: Cursed be their anger, for it was violent; And their rage, for it was cruel! I will divide them in Jacob, And scatter them in Israel.

results.title: Genesis 49:24
results.preview: But his bow abideth firm, And the arms of his hands are supple By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob. From thence is the shepherd, the stone of Israel:

results.title: Genesis 49:33
results.preview: And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered his feet into the bed, and expired, and was gathered to his peoples.

results.title: Genesis 50:24
results.preview: And Joseph said to his brethren, I die; and God will certainly visit you, and bring you up out of this land, into the land that he swore unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

results.title: Exodus 1:1
results.preview: And these are the names of the sons of Israel who had come into Egypt; with Jacob had they come, each with his household:

results.title: Exodus 1:5
results.preview: And all the souls that had come out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls; and Joseph was in Egypt.

results.title: Exodus 2:24
results.preview: and God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob;

results.title: Exodus 3:6
results.preview: And he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look at God.

results.title: Exodus 3:15
results.preview: And God said moreover to Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel: Jehovah, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you. This is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.

results.title: Exodus 3:16
results.preview: Go and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, Jehovah the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, hath appeared to me, saying, I have indeed visited you, and seen that which is done unto you in Egypt;

results.title: Exodus 4:5
results.preview: that they may believe that Jehovah, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared unto thee.

results.title: Exodus 6:3
results.preview: And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, as the Almighty •God; but by my name Jehovah I was not made known to them.

results.title: Exodus 6:8
results.preview: And I will bring you into the land concerning which I swore to give it unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; and I will give it you for a possession: I am Jehovah.

results.title: Exodus 19:3
results.preview: And Moses went up to God, and Jehovah called to him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:

results.title: Exodus 33:1

results.title: Leviticus 26:42
results.preview: I will remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham will I remember; and I will remember the land.

results.title: Numbers 23:7
results.preview: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, from the mountains of the east: Come, curse me Jacob, and come, denounce Israel!

results.title: Numbers 23:10
results.preview: Who can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let my soul die the death of the righteous, and let my end be like his!

results.title: Numbers 23:21
results.preview: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen wrong in Israel; Jehovah his God is with him, and the shout of a king is in his midst.

results.title: Numbers 23:23
results.preview: For there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel. At this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath •God wrought!

results.title: Numbers 24:5
results.preview: How goodly are thy tents, Jacob, and thy tabernacles, Israel!

results.title: Numbers 24:17
results.preview: I shall see him, but not now; I shall behold him, but not nigh: There cometh a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and he shall cut in pieces the corners of Moab, and destroy all the sons of tumult.

results.title: Numbers 24:19
results.preview: And one out of Jacob shall have dominion, and will destroy out of the city what remaineth.

results.title: Numbers 32:11
results.preview: If the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land that I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob! for they have not wholly followed me;

results.title: Deuteronomy 1:8
results.preview: Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which Jehovah swore unto your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.

results.title: Deuteronomy 6:10
results.preview: And it shall be, when Jehovah thy God bringeth thee into the land which he swore unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give thee: great and good cities which thou buildedst not,

results.title: Deuteronomy 9:5
results.preview: Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thy heart, dost thou enter in to possess their land, but for the wickedness of these nations doth Jehovah thy God dispossess them from before thee, and that he may perform the word which Jehovah swore unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

results.title: Deuteronomy 9:27
results.preview: Remember thy servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not at the stubbornness of this people, nor at their wickedness, nor at their sin;

results.title: Deuteronomy 29:13
results.preview: that he may establish thee this day for a people unto himself, and that he may be to thee a God, as he hath said unto thee, and as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

results.title: Deuteronomy 30:20
results.preview: in loving Jehovah thy God, in hearkening to his voice, and in cleaving to him—for this is thy life and the length of thy days—that thou mayest dwell in the land which Jehovah swore unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.

results.title: Deuteronomy 32:9
results.preview: For Jehovah’s portion is his people; Jacob the lot of his inheritance.

results.title: Deuteronomy 33:4
results.preview: Moses commanded us a law, The inheritance of the congregation of Jacob.

results.title: Deuteronomy 33:10
results.preview: They shall teach Jacob thine ordinances, And Israel thy law: They shall put incense before thy nostrils, And whole burnt-offering upon thine altar.

results.title: Deuteronomy 33:28
results.preview: And Israel shall dwell in safety alone, The fountain of Jacob, in a land of corn and new wine; Also his heavens shall drop down dew.

results.title: Deuteronomy 34:4
results.preview: And Jehovah said unto him, This is the land that I swore unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it: I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.

results.preview: And I gave unto Isaac Jacob and Esau; and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; and Jacob and his sons went down into Egypt.

results.title: Joshua 24:32
results.preview: And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel had brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem in the portion of the field which Jacob had bought of the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs; and it became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.

results.title: 1 Samuel 12:8
results.preview: When Jacob had come into Egypt, and your fathers cried to Jehovah, then Jehovah sent Moses and Aaron, and they brought your fathers forth out of Egypt, and made them dwell in this place.

results.title: 2 Samuel 23:1

results.preview: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of Jehovah came saying, Israel shall be thy name;

results.title: 2 Kings 13:23
results.preview: And Jehovah was gracious to them, and had compassion on them, and had respect to them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and he would not destroy them, neither did he cast them from his presence up to that time.

results.title: 2 Kings 17:34
results.preview: To this day they do after their former customs: they fear not Jehovah, neither do they after their statutes or after their ordinances, nor after the law and commandment that Jehovah commanded the sons of Jacob, whom he named Israel.

results.title: 1 Chronicles 16:13
results.preview: Ye seed of Israel his servant, Ye sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.

results.title: 1 Chronicles 16:17
results.preview: And he confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, Unto Israel for an everlasting covenant,

results.preview: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When Jehovah turneth again the captivity of his people, Jacob shall be glad, Israel shall rejoice.

results.title: Psalm 20:1
results.preview: Jehovah answer thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob protect thee;

results.title: Psalm 22:23
results.preview: Ye that fear Jehovah, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and revere him, all ye the seed of Israel.

results.title: Psalm 24:6
results.preview: This is the generation of them that seek unto him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 44:4

results.title: Psalm 46:7
results.preview: Jehovah of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high fortress. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 46:11
results.preview: Jehovah of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high fortress. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 47:4
results.preview: He hath chosen our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 53:6
results.preview: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God turneth again the captivity of his people, Jacob shall be glad, Israel shall rejoice.

results.title: Psalm 59:13
results.preview: Make an end in wrath, make an end, that they may be no more; that they may know that God ruleth in Jacob, unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

results.preview: But as for me, I will declare for ever; I will sing psalms to the God of Jacob.

results.title: Psalm 76:6
results.preview: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

results.title: Psalm 77:15
results.preview: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 78:5

results.title: Psalm 78:71
results.preview: From following the suckling-ewes, he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

results.title: Psalm 79:7
results.preview: For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his habitation.

results.title: Psalm 81:1
results.preview: Sing ye joyously unto God our strength, shout aloud unto the God of Jacob;

results.title: Psalm 81:4
results.preview: For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob;

results.preview: Jehovah, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

results.title: Psalm 85:1
results.preview: Thou hast been favourable, Jehovah, unto thy land; thou hast turned the captivity of Jacob:

results.title: Psalm 87:2
results.preview: Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion more than all the habitations of Jacob.

results.title: Psalm 94:7
results.preview: And say, Jah will not see, neither will the God of Jacob regard it.

results.title: Psalm 99:4
results.preview: And the strength of the king that loveth justice. Thou hast established equity: it is thou that executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

results.title: Psalm 105:6

results.preview: And he confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, unto Israel for an everlasting covenant,

results.preview: And Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

results.preview: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,

results.preview: Blessed is he who hath the •God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Jehovah his God,

results.title: Isaiah 2:3
results.preview: And many peoples shall go and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of Jehovah, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths. For out of Zion shall go forth the law, and Jehovah’s word from Jerusalem.

results.title: Isaiah 2:5
results.preview: House of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of Jehovah.

results.title: Isaiah 2:6
results.preview: For thou hast cast off thy people, the house of Jacob, because they are filled with what comes from the east, and use auguries like the Philistines, and ally themselves with the children of foreigners.

results.title: Isaiah 8:17
results.preview: And I will wait for Jehovah, who hideth his face from the house of Jacob; and I will look for him.

results.title: Isaiah 9:8
results.preview: The Lord sent a word unto Jacob, and it lighteth upon Israel.

results.title: Isaiah 10:20
results.preview: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob shall no more again rely upon him that smote them; but they shall rely upon Jehovah, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

results.title: Isaiah 10:21
results.preview: The remnant shall return, the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty •God.

results.title: Isaiah 14:1
results.preview: For Jehovah will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in rest in their own land; and the stranger shall be united to them, and they shall be joined to the house of Jacob.

results.title: Isaiah 17:4
results.preview: And in that day it shall come to pass, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall become lean.

results.title: Isaiah 27:6
results.preview: In the future Jacob shall take root; Israel shall blossom and bud, and they shall fill the face of the world with fruit.

results.title: Isaiah 27:9
results.preview: By this, therefore, shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit of the taking away of his sin: when he shall make all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are crumbled in pieces, —the Asherahs and the sun-images shall not stand.

results.title: Isaiah 29:22
results.preview: Therefore thus saith Jehovah who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now be pale;

results.title: Isaiah 29:23
results.preview: for when he seeth his children, the work of my hands, in the midst of him, they shall hallow my name, and hallow the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.

results.title: Isaiah 40:27
results.preview: Why sayest thou, Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from Jehovah, and my right is passed away from my God?

results.title: Isaiah 41:8
results.preview: But thou, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham, my friend

results.title: Isaiah 41:14
results.preview: Fear not, thou worm Jacob, ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith Jehovah, and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

results.title: Isaiah 41:21
results.preview: Produce your cause, saith Jehovah; bring forward your arguments, saith the King of Jacob.

results.title: Isaiah 42:24
results.preview: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? Did not Jehovah, he against whom we have sinned? And they would not walk in his ways, neither did they hearken unto his law.

results.title: Isaiah 43:1
results.preview: But now thus saith Jehovah, that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel: Fear not, for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.

results.title: Isaiah 43:22
results.preview: —But thou hast not called upon me, Jacob; for thou hast been weary of me, O Israel:

results.title: Isaiah 43:28
results.preview: And I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the ban, and Israel to reproaches.

results.title: Isaiah 44:1
results.preview: And now hear, Jacob, my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen:

results.title: Isaiah 44:2
results.preview: thus saith Jehovah, that made thee, and formed thee from the womb, who helpeth thee, Fear not, Jacob, my servant, and thou, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

results.title: Isaiah 44:5
results.preview: One shall say, I am Jehovah’s; and another shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall write with his hand: I am Jehovah’s, and surname himself by the name of Israel.

results.title: Isaiah 44:21
results.preview: Remember these things, O Jacob, and Israel, for thou art my servant; I have formed thee: thou art my servant, Israel; thou shalt not be forgotten of me.

results.title: Isaiah 44:23
results.preview: Sing, ye heavens; for Jehovah hath done it: shout, ye lower parts of the earth; break forth into singing, ye mountains, the forest, and every tree therein! For Jehovah hath redeemed Jacob, and glorified himself in Israel.

results.title: Isaiah 45:4
results.preview: For Jacob my servant’s sake, and Israel mine elect, I have called thee by thy name; I surnamed thee, though thou didst not know me;

results.title: Isaiah 45:19
results.preview: I have not spoken in secret, in a dark place of the earth; I said not unto the seed of Jacob, Seek me in vain: I am Jehovah, speaking righteousness, declaring things which are right.

results.title: Isaiah 46:3
results.preview: Hearken unto me, house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, ye who have been borne from the belly, who have been carried from the womb:

results.title: Isaiah 48:1
results.preview: Hear ye this, house of Jacob, who are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, who swear by the name of Jehovah, and make mention of the God of Israel, not in truth, nor in righteousness.

results.title: Isaiah 48:12
results.preview: Hearken unto me, Jacob, and thou Israel, my called. I am HE; I, the first, and I, the last.

results.title: Isaiah 48:20
results.preview: Go ye forth from Babylon, flee from the Chaldeans, with a voice of singing; declare, cause this to be heard, utter it to the end of the earth; say ye, Jehovah hath redeemed his servant Jacob.

results.title: Isaiah 49:5
results.preview: And now, saith Jehovah, that formed me from the womb to be his servant, that I should bring Jacob again to him; (though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorified in the eyes of Jehovah, and my God shall be my strength;)

results.title: Isaiah 49:6
results.preview: —and he saith, It is a small thing that thou shouldest be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the preserved of Israel; I have even given thee for a light of the nations, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the earth.

results.title: Isaiah 49:26
results.preview: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with new wine. And all flesh shall know that I, Jehovah, am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

results.title: Isaiah 58:1
results.preview: Cry aloud, spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and declare unto my people their transgression, and to the house of Jacob their sins.

results.title: Isaiah 58:14
results.preview: then shalt thou delight thyself in Jehovah, and I will cause thee to ride on the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken.

results.title: Isaiah 59:20
results.preview: And the Redeemer will come to Zion, and unto them that turn from transgression in Jacob, saith Jehovah.

results.title: Isaiah 60:16
results.preview: And thou shalt suck the milk of the nations, and shalt suck the breast of kings; and thou shalt know that I, Jehovah, am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

results.title: Isaiah 65:9
results.preview: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah a possessor of my mountains; and mine elect shall possess it, and my servants shall dwell there.

results.preview: Hear the word of Jehovah, house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel.

results.title: Jeremiah 5:20
results.preview: Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,

results.title: Jeremiah 10:16
results.preview: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for it is he that hath formed all things, and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: Jehovah of hosts is his name.

results.title: Jeremiah 10:25
results.preview: Pour out thy fury upon the nations that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name; for they have eaten up Jacob, yea, they have eaten him up and consumed him, and have laid waste his dwelling-place.

results.title: Jeremiah 30:7
results.preview: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

results.title: Jeremiah 30:10
results.preview: And thou, my servant Jacob, fear not, saith Jehovah; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for behold, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

results.title: Jeremiah 30:18
results.preview: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will turn the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his habitations; and the city shall be built upon her own heap; and the palace shall be inhabited after the manner thereof.

results.title: Jeremiah 31:7
results.preview: For thus saith Jehovah: Sing aloud with gladness for Jacob, and shout at the head of the nations; publish ye, praise ye, and say, Jehovah, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.

results.title: Jeremiah 31:11
results.preview: For Jehovah hath ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of one stronger than he.

results.title: Jeremiah 33:26
results.preview: then will I also cast away the seed of Jacob, and of David my servant, so as not to take of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will turn their captivity, and will have mercy on them.

results.title: Jeremiah 46:27
results.preview: But thou, my servant Jacob, fear not, neither be dismayed, Israel: for behold, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and be in rest and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

results.title: Jeremiah 46:28
results.preview: Fear thou not, my servant Jacob, saith Jehovah: for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; but I will correct thee with judgment, and I will not hold thee altogether guiltless.

results.title: Jeremiah 51:19
results.preview: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for it is he that hath formed all things: and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: Jehovah of hosts is his name.

results.title: Lamentations 1:17
results.preview: Zion spreadeth forth her hands; there is none to comfort her; Jehovah hath commanded concerning Jacob, that his adversaries should be round about him; Jerusalem is as an impurity among them.

results.title: Lamentations 2:2
results.preview: The Lord hath swallowed up all the dwellings of Jacob, and hath not spared; he hath thrown down in his wrath the strongholds of the daughter of Judah: he hath brought them down to the ground; he hath profaned the kingdom and the princes thereof.

results.title: Lamentations 2:3
results.preview: He hath cut off in fierce anger all the horn of Israel: he hath withdrawn his right hand from before the enemy; and he burned up Jacob like a flaming fire, devouring round about.

results.title: Ezekiel 20:5
results.preview: and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: In the day when I chose Israel, and lifted up my hand unto the seed of the house of Jacob, and made myself known unto them in the land of Egypt, when I lifted up my hand unto them, saying, I am Jehovah your God,

results.title: Ezekiel 28:25
results.preview: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and shall be hallowed in them in the sight of the nations, then shall they dwell in their land which I have given to my servant Jacob.

results.title: Ezekiel 37:25
results.preview: And they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant, wherein your fathers have dwelt; and they shall dwell therein, they, and their children, and their children’s children for ever: and David my servant shall be their prince for ever.

results.title: Ezekiel 39:25
results.preview: Therefore, thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Now will I bring again the captivity of Jacob, and have mercy upon the whole house of Israel, and will be jealous for my holy name:

results.title: Hosea 10:11
results.preview: And Ephraim is a trained heifer, that loveth to tread out the corn; I have passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to draw; Judah shall plough, Jacob shall break his clods.

results.title: Hosea 12:2
results.preview: Jehovah hath also a controversy with Judah, and he will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.

results.title: Hosea 12:12
results.preview: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

results.title: Amos 3:13
results.preview: Hear ye, and testify in the house of Jacob, saith the Lord Jehovah, the God of hosts,

results.title: Amos 6:8
results.preview: The Lord Jehovah hath sworn by himself, saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, I abhor the pride of Jacob, and hate his palaces; and I will deliver up the city with all that is therein.

results.title: Amos 7:2
results.preview: And it came to pass, when they had wholly eaten the grass of the land, that I said, O Lord Jehovah, forgive, I beseech thee! How shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

results.title: Amos 7:5
results.preview: Then said I, O Lord Jehovah, cease, I beseech thee! How shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

results.title: Amos 8:7
results.preview: Jehovah hath sworn by the glory of Jacob, Certainly I will never forget any of their works.

results.title: Amos 9:8
results.preview: Behold, the eyes of the Lord Jehovah are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth: only that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith Jehovah.

results.title: Obadiah 10
results.preview: Because of violence against thy brother Jacob, shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.

results.title: Obadiah 17
results.preview: But upon mount Zion shall there be deliverance, and it shall be holy; and the house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.

results.title: Obadiah 18
results.preview: And the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble; and they shall kindle in them and devour them; and there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau: for Jehovah hath spoken it.

results.title: Micah 1:5
results.preview: For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. Whence is the transgression of Jacob? is it not from Samaria? And whence are the high places of Judah? are they not from Jerusalem?

results.title: Micah 2:7
results.preview: O thou that art named the house of Jacob, Is Jehovah impatient? are these his doings? Do not my words do good to him that walketh uprightly?

results.title: Micah 2:12
results.preview: I will surely assemble, O Jacob, the whole of thee; I will surely gather the remnant of Israel; I will put them together as sheep of Bozrah, as a flock in the midst of their pasture: they shall make great noise by reason of the multitude of men.

results.title: Micah 3:1
results.preview: And I said, Hear, I pray you, ye heads of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel: Is it not for you to know judgment?

results.title: Micah 3:8
results.preview: But truly I am filled with power by the Spirit of Jehovah, and with judgment and with might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.

results.title: Micah 3:9
results.preview: Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity,

results.title: Micah 4:2
results.preview: And many nations shall go and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of Jehovah, and to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths. For out of Zion shall go forth the law, and Jehovah’s word from Jerusalem.

results.title: Micah 5:7
results.preview: And the remnant of Jacob shall be in the midst of many peoples as dew from Jehovah, as showers upon the grass, that tarrieth not for man, neither waiteth for the sons of men.

results.title: Micah 5:8
results.preview: And the remnant of Jacob shall be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, as a lion among the beasts of the forest, as a young lion among the flocks of sheep: who, if he go through, treadeth down, and teareth in pieces, and there is none to deliver.

results.title: Micah 7:20
results.preview: Thou wilt perform truth to Jacob, loving-kindness to Abraham, which thou hast sworn unto our fathers, from the days of old.

results.title: Nahum 2:2
results.preview: For Jehovah hath brought again the glory of Jacob, as the glory of Israel; for the wasters have wasted them, and marred their vine-branches.

results.title: Malachi 1:2
results.preview: I have loved you, saith Jehovah; but ye say, Wherein hast thou loved us? Was not Esau Jacob’s brother? saith Jehovah, and I loved Jacob,

results.title: Malachi 2:12
results.preview: Jehovah will cut off from the tents of Jacob the man that doeth this, him that calleth and him that answereth; and him that offereth an oblation unto Jehovah of hosts.

results.title: Malachi 3:6
results.preview: For I Jehovah change not, and ye, sons of Jacob, are not consumed.

results.title: Matthew 1:2
results.preview: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat Juda and his brethren;

results.title: Matthew 1:15
results.preview: and Eliud begat Eliazar, and Eliazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,

results.title: Matthew 1:16
results.preview: and Jacob begat Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

results.title: Matthew 8:11
results.preview: But I say unto you, that many shall come from the rising and setting sun, and shall lie down at table with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens;

results.title: Matthew 22:32
results.preview: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not God of the dead, but of the living.

results.title: Mark 12:26
results.preview: But concerning the dead that they rise, have ye not read in the book of Moses, in the section of the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

results.title: Luke 1:33
results.preview: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for the ages, and of his kingdom there shall not be an end.

results.title: Luke 3:34
results.preview: of Jacob, of Isaac, of Abraham, of Terah, of Nachor,

results.title: Luke 13:28
results.preview: There shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves cast out.

results.title: Luke 20:37
results.preview: But that the dead rise, even Moses shewed in the section of the bush, when he called the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob;

results.title: John 4:5
results.preview: He comes therefore to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near to the land which Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

results.title: John 4:6
results.preview: Now a fountain of Jacob’s was there; Jesus therefore, being wearied with the way he had come, sat just as he was at the fountain. It was about the sixth hour.

results.title: John 4:12
results.preview: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, and his sons, and his cattle?

results.title: Acts 3:13
results.preview: The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus, whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he had judged that he should be let go.

results.title: Acts 7:8
results.preview: And he gave to him the covenant of circumcision; and thus he begat Isaac and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac Jacob, and Jacob the twelve patriarchs.

results.title: Acts 7:12
results.preview: But Jacob, having heard of there being corn in Egypt, sent out our fathers first;

results.title: Acts 7:14
results.preview: And Joseph sent and called down to him his father Jacob and all his kindred, seventy-five souls.

results.title: Acts 7:15
results.preview: And Jacob went down into Egypt and died, he and our fathers,

results.title: Acts 7:32
results.preview: I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob. And Moses trembled, and durst not consider it.

results.title: Acts 7:46
results.preview: who found favour before God, and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob;

results.title: Romans 9:13
results.preview: according as it is written, I have loved Jacob, and I have hated Esau.

results.title: Romans 11:26
results.preview: and so all Israel shall be saved. According as it is written, The deliverer shall come out of Zion; he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

results.title: Hebrews 11:9
results.preview: By faith he sojourned as a stranger in the land of promise as a foreign country, having dwelt in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise;

results.title: Hebrews 11:20
results.preview: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

results.title: Hebrews 11:21
results.preview: By faith Jacob when dying blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshipped on the top of his staff.
